concise_definition: n. 鞠躬, 行礼; v. 鞠躬, 屈服, 弯曲

definitions.explanation_en: The act of bending the head or body forward as a gesture of respect, greeting, or submission, commonly practiced in formal or cultural contexts.
definitions.explanation_cn: 作为尊重、问候或顺从的表示，头部或身体向前弯曲的动作，常见于正式或文化场合。
definitions.example_en: She gave a deep bowing to the audience after her performance.
definitions.example_cn: 她在演出结束后向观众深深鞠了一躬。

definitions.explanation_en: To bend the head or body forward, especially as a sign of respect, deference, or worship.
definitions.explanation_cn: 将头部或身体向前弯曲，尤指表示尊重、顺从或崇拜。
definitions.example_en: The courtiers bowed low before the emperor.
definitions.example_cn: 朝臣们在皇帝面前深深鞠躬。

definitions.explanation_en: To yield or submit under pressure, often metaphorically, as in yielding to demands or authority.
definitions.explanation_cn: 在压力下屈服或让步，常为比喻用法，指对要求或权威低头。
definitions.example_en: The government refused to be bowing to the protesters' demands.
definitions.example_cn: 政府拒绝向抗议者的要求屈服。

definitions.explanation_en: To bend or curve under weight or pressure, often describing physical deformation of objects.
definitions.explanation_cn: 在重量或压力下弯曲或变形，常用于描述物体的物理形变。
definitions.example_en: The old wooden beam was bowing under the weight of the roof.
definitions.example_cn: 那根旧木梁在屋顶的重压下弯曲了。

comparison.analysis: “Curtseying”（屈膝礼）特指女性在西方传统礼仪中行的屈膝礼，通常伴随膝盖弯曲和身体下蹲，是“bowing”在特定性别和文化语境中的变体。而 “bowing” 更通用，适用于男女及多种文化背景，动作以躯干前倾为主。
“Kneeling”（跪下）是双膝着地的完全俯身姿态，通常表达极高的敬意、祈祷或臣服，比 “bowing” 更具身体强度和宗教/仪式感。而 “bowing” 通常保持站立或半蹲，动作幅度较小，更常用于日常礼节。
“Yielding”（让步）是抽象意义上的屈服，强调在意见、权力或要求上的退让，不涉及身体动作。而 “bowing” 在比喻用法中虽可表示屈服，但其本义始终与身体动作相关，更具形象性和视觉性。
